poem:
### Silent Harm

A small sacrifice,  
an innocent weight,  
fluttering notes  
on morning air. Yet,  
beneath their song,  
a whisper of chemicals  
seeps unseen, disruptive   
choreography of feathers  
and death. Nature's  
dialogue with itself  
halts, poisoned by  
misguided care,  
seeking redemption  
in the quiet eyes  
of a beloved pet.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How can you treat your pet for fleas without harming nature? The chemicals used in standard flea treatments are polluting waterways and having a drastic effect on wildlife in the UK, killing songbird chicks. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
